title: Citi Handlowy's 'Shopping Madness' Campaign
summary: Warsaw, Poland - Citi Handlowy, Elle and Instyle magazines' joint campaign 'Shopping Madness' took place September 29-30. All over Poland, Citi Handlowy credit cards holders and readers of Elle and Instyle took advantage of special discount coupons, enjoyed discounts and deals and were able to take part in special fashion events at more than 160 Citi Handlowy credit card partner stores.
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – Citi Handlowy, Elle and Instyle magazines' joint campaign 'Shopping Madness' took place September 29-30. All over Poland, Citi Handlowy credit cards holders and readers of Elle and Instyle took advantage of special discount coupons, enjoyed discounts and deals and were able to take part in special fashion events at more than 160 Citi Handlowy credit card partner stores.
tag-3: Katarzyna Józefowicz, Head of Assets, Consumer Bank at Citi Handlowy, said: "The Shopping Madness campaign promoting the idea of smart shopping is very important to us for two reasons. We believe in the philosophy of smart money management and have been popularizing smart shopping for years. Our credit card holders can benefit from one of the broadest partnership programs with almost 5,000 partner stores across Poland. The campaign also strengthens our long-term relationship with Elle, with whom we released the first co-branded credit card, the Citibank ELLE card, in 1997." Katarzyna Józefowicz provides more information on the Citi's involvement in the 'Shopping Madness' campaign in a short video featured on Citi Handlowy's YouTube channel.
tag-4: Citi Handlowy is the Polish market leader in credit cards with a 23 percent market share in transaction volumes. In 1997 Citi was the first bank in Poland to offer Poles a credit card accepted worldwide. Citi continues to innovate, and Citi Handlowy cards are available as stickers which can be stuck to the back of mobile phones to take advantage of PayPass functionality. Citi is extremely concerned about the security of client's money; cardholders are reimbursed for unauthorized transactions exceeding PLN 100 for up to 72 hours prior to reporting loss or theft of the card.
tag-5: To celebrate the 'Shopping Madness' campaign, Citi Handlowy launched a special application called 'Catch Products – Win Prizes' on the Facebook "Discount-Seekers" fan page.
tag-6: By "catching" products from the partners of the shopping madness campaign in their "baskets", application users could win daily prizes including H&M vouchers worth PLN 100. Every product was marked with the logo of the partner and the amount of discount a customer would receive by paying with his or her Citi credit card. Prizes were awarded to players with the highest scores achieved in the shortest time in a single game. An additional prize of PLN 300 was awarded to the player with the best score in the whole competition.
tag-7: You can watch a preview of the "Shopping Madness" campaign on the Citi Handlowy YouTube channel.
tag-8: More information on the campaign can be found at: www.citirabaty.pl and on the "Discount-Seekers" Fan Page.

tag-12: The City of London initiative on London as a centre for renminbi business The City of London initiative on London as a centre for renminbi business was launched on 18 April 2012. It aims to develop London's position as the leading western hub for international renminbi (RMB) business - and boost the RMB's wider international use for trade and investment. The initiative is facilitated by the City of London Corporation, and the current members are Bank of China, Barclays, China Construction Bank, Citi, Deutsche Bank, HSBC, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, JPMorgan, Royal Bank of Scotland and Standard Chartered, with observers from HM Treasury, the Bank of England, and the Financial Services Authority. The initiative seeks to provide leadership to the wider financial markets on technical, infrastructure and regulatory issues relating to the RMB product and services in London. It also advises HM Treasury on maximising London's capacity to trade, clear and settle RMB and articulates practical next steps and long-term aims for the further development of the RMB market in London. Additionally, the group advises HM Treasury and other UK authorities on any financial stability concerns members may perceive. More information is at www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/renminbi
